secondaryWindow.alwaysOnTop: When enabled, the secondary window stays above all other windows, including those of different applications.
secondaryWindow.description: Sets the initial position and size of the extracted secondary window.
secondaryWindow.fullSize: The position and size of the extracted widget will be the same as the running Theia application.
secondaryWindow.halfWidth: The position and size of the extracted widget will be half the width of the running Theia application.
secondaryWindow.originalSize: The position and size of the extracted widget will be the same as the original widget.

core.silentNotifications: Controls whether to suppress notification popups.
core.tabDefaultSize: Specifies the default size for tabs.
core.tabMaximize: Controls whether to maximize tabs on double click.
core.tabMinimumSize: Specifies the minimum size for tabs.
core.tabShrinkToFit: Shrink tabs to fit available space.

debug.addConfigurationPlaceholder: Select workspace root to add configuration to
debug.compound-cycle: Launch configuration '{0}' contains a cycle with itself
debug.missingConfiguration: Dynamic configuration '{0}:{1}' is missing or not applicable
debug.toggleTracing: Enable/disable tracing communications with debug adapters

editor.diffEditor.wordWrap2: Lines will wrap according to the `#editor.wordWrap#` setting.
editor.dirtyEncoding: The file is dirty. Please save it first before reopening it with another encoding.
editor.editor.accessibilitySupport0: Use platform APIs to detect when a Screen Reader is attached
editor.editor.accessibilitySupport1: Optimize for usage with a Screen Reader
editor.editor.accessibilitySupport2: Assume a screen reader is not attached
editor.editor.bracketPairColorization.enabled: Controls whether bracket pair colorization is enabled or not. Use `#workbench.colorCustomizations#` to override the bracket highlight colors.
editor.editor.codeActionWidget.includeNearbyQui: Enable/disable showing nearest quickfix within a line when not currently on a diagnostic.
editor.editor.detectIndentation: Controls whether `#editor.tabSize#` and `#editor.insertSpaces#` will be automatically detected when a file is opened based on the file contents.
editor.editor.dropIntoEditor.enabled: Controls whether you can drag and drop a file into a text editor by holding down `shift` (instead of opening the file in an editor).
editor.editor.formatOnSaveMode.modificationsIfA: Will attempt to format modifications only (requires source control). If source control can't be used, then the whole file will be formatted.
editor.editor.hover.hidingDelay: Controls the delay in milliseconds after thich the hover is hidden. Requires `editor.hover.sticky` to be enabled.
editor.editor.inlayHints.enabled1: Inlay hints are showing by default and hide when holding Ctrl+Alt
editor.editor.inlayHints.enabled2: Inlay hints are hidden by default and show when holding Ctrl+Alt
editor.editor.inlayHints.fontFamily: Controls font family of inlay hints in the editor. When set to empty, the `#editor.fontFamily#` is used.
editor.editor.inlayHints.fontSize: Controls font size of inlay hints in the editor. As default the `#editor.fontSize#` is used when the configured value is less than `5` or greater than the editor font size.
editor.editor.insertSpaces: Insert spaces when pressing `Tab`. This setting is overridden based on the file contents when `#editor.detectIndentation#` is on.
editor.editor.occurrencesHighlight: Controls whether the editor should highlight semantic symbol occurrences.
editor.editor.quickSuggestions: Controls whether suggestions should automatically show up while typing. This can be controlled for typing in comments, strings, and other code. Quick suggestion can be configured to show as ghost text or with the suggest widget. Also be aware of the '#editor.suggestOnTriggerCharacters#'-setting which controls if suggestions are triggered by special characters.
editor.editor.stickyScroll.scrollWithEditor: Enable scrolling of the sticky scroll widget with the editor's horizontal scrollbar.
editor.editor.suggestFontSize: Font size for the suggest widget. When set to `0`, the value of `#editor.fontSize#` is used.
editor.editor.suggestLineHeight: Line height for the suggest widget. When set to `0`, the value of `#editor.lineHeight#` is used. The minimum value is 8.
editor.editor.tabSize: The number of spaces a tab is equal to. This setting is overridden based on the file contents when `#editor.detectIndentation#` is on.
editor.editor.useTabStops: Inserting and deleting whitespace follows tab stops.
editor.editor.wordBasedSuggestions: Controls whether completions should be computed based on words in the document.
editor.editor.wordBasedSuggestionsMode: Controls from which documents word based completions are computed.
editor.files.autoSave: Controls [auto save](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/codebasics#_save-auto-save) of editors that have unsaved changes.
editor.files.autoSave.afterDelay: An editor with changes is automatically saved after the configured `#files.autoSaveDelay#`.
editor.files.autoSave.off: An editor with changes is never automatically saved.
editor.files.autoSave.onFocusChange: An editor with changes is automatically saved when the editor loses focus.
editor.files.autoSave.onWindowChange: An editor with changes is automatically saved when the window loses focus.
editor.formatOnSaveTimeout: Timeout in milliseconds after which the formatting that is run on file save is cancelled.
editor.persistClosedEditors: Controls whether to persist closed editor history for the workspace across window reloads.

filesystem.filesExclude: Configure glob patterns for excluding files and folders. For example, the file Explorer decides which files and folders to show or hide based on this setting.
filesystem.maxConcurrentUploads: Maximum number of concurrent files to upload when uploading multiple files. 0 means all files will be uploaded concurrently.
filesystem.maxFileSizeMB: Controls the max file size in MB which is possible to open.

terminal.enableCopy: Enable ctrl-c (cmd-c on macOS) to copy selected text
terminal.enablePaste: Enable ctrl-v (cmd-v on macOS) to paste from clipboard
terminal.profileArgs: The shell arguments that this profile uses.
terminal.profileColor: A terminal theme color ID to associate with the terminal.
terminal.profileIcon:
A codicon ID to associate with the terminal icon.
terminal-tmux:"$(terminal-tmux)"
terminal.profilePath: The path of the shell that this profile uses.
terminal.profiles:
The profiles to present when creating a new terminal. Set the path property manually with optional args.
Set an existing profile to `null` to hide the profile from the list, for example: `"{0}": null`.
terminal.rendererType: Controls how the terminal is rendered.
terminal.rendererTypeDeprecationMessage: The renderer type is no longer supported as an option.
terminal.selectProfile: Select a profile for the new terminal
terminal.shell.deprecated: This is deprecated, the new recommended way to configure your default shell is by creating a terminal profile in 'terminal.integrated.profiles.{0}' and setting its profile name as the default in 'terminal.integrated.defaultProfile.{0}.'
terminal.shellArgsLinux: The command line arguments to use when on the Linux terminal.
terminal.shellArgsOsx: The command line arguments to use when on the macOS terminal.
terminal.shellArgsWindows: The command line arguments to use when on the Windows terminal.
terminal.shellLinux: The path of the shell that the terminal uses on Linux (default: '{0}'}).
terminal.shellOsx: The path of the shell that the terminal uses on macOS (default: '{0}'}).
terminal.shellWindows: The path of the shell that the terminal uses on Windows. (default: '{0}').
